channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023120588
item.description:
Report X-2023120588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained eleven glass jars packed with Styrofoam peanuts. One of the jars broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120365
item.description:
Report X-2023120365

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet in tote smelling faintly of alcohol. Prior context unknown. Mishandling: overhead scan 12/3 20:26 at NASH. Package brought under ventilation. DescribePack: One of three 4 Liter jerricans lost 2oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure, despite tape-like band around cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023120364
item.description:
Report X-2023120364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazard class 8 hazmat spill found by APA on QA Intercept / Overhead Discharge Chute. Mishandling: Ftrack shows overhead scan 12/2 21:52 at NASH. The package was placed in a lined tote for transport to the HMPA. DescribePack: Two of two 1 gallon jerricans lost 6oz of fluid due to internal corrosion of the safety seals under the cap closures. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023120661
item.description:
Report X-2023120661

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to our attention from just the smell alone. Once it was confirmed to be a damaged hazmat, it was promptly placed into a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red hazardous tote. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further investigation. DescribePack: The package itself was sealed but had wet stains all over, mostly towards the bottom of the box. The plastic cap was completely off, and the metal sealant was also pull up a bit which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside of a hazardous plastic bag and red tote to mitigate any additional spillage and keep the strong fumes at contained.

item.title: Report E-2023120204
item.description:
Report E-2023120204

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 1, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN3265 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3265-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-galon drums. The two (2) damaged 55-gallon drums were overpacked into two (2) 95-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023120402

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. PKG PLACED INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION. DescribePack: PKG WAS OPENED AND THREE OF THE CONENTS WAS MISSING. ONE CONTENT CAP WAS MISSING. IT APPEARS LIQUID MAY HAVE LEAKED BUT THE BOX WASN'T WET. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UPRIGHT SO LIQUID WOULDN'T LEAK

item.title: Report X-2023120380
item.description:
Report X-2023120380

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention, it was promptly placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Upon seeing the type of contents inside, the package was then brought to the HazMat cage for further investigation. DescribePack: The package had a bleached, wet patch at the bottom of the box. Two of the bottles had loose caps however only one of them was entirely off which caused a spillage. The bottles were individually placed inside of plastic ziploc bags so that helped with keeping the bleach contained. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023120376
item.description:
Report X-2023120376

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to our attention as it had a wet surface at the bottom and slight leakage. The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any additional potential spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further investigation. It was also found that a previous station did not report the the first damages properly and instead made a RTS report. DescribePack: The box was entirely soaked at the bottom and had some minor leaks spilling out. Two of the 1-gallon bottles had loose caps which resulted in a spillage although they were all inside of a plastic bag which mitigated a lot of the spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was brought to our attention, it was quickly placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any potential additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The bottom of the box was soaked in the detergent. One of the 2.5-gallon bottles had a broken cap. The cap is crack on one side which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any potential additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023120507
item.description:
Report X-2023120507

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. A metal can inside of the box leaked liquid that was bubbling, steaming and had corroded away a large portion of the metal can. PH litmus test resulted as strong acid (1). Contents also included a paint brush, a steel brush, and 2 rotary brushes. The metal can was unidentifiable due to the level of corrosion. The contents were neutralized with baking soda and placed into a Steel Salvage Package. The customer was contacted and advised that the shipment contained Pickling Paste. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023120419

Report X-2023120419

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was brought to our attention, it was promptly placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then transferred into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage. As it was discovered that the bottles contained hydrogen peroxide, the tote was immediately transferred to the HazMat station for further investigation. DescribePack: Two of the 1-gallon bottles had a crack that spread from the bottom of the bottle to the side, which caused a spillage. Both bottles leaked entirely into a the tote. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was promptly placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then transferred into a tote to mitigate additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023120464
item.description:
Report X-2023120464

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023120464 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 4oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Bottle appeared dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated. 2. X-2023120465 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of three 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 0.3L of fluid due to a loose cap closure. Bottle appeared dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated. 3. X-2023120467 SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with Flammable Liquid DOT diamond label found damaged on loadside. Package was placed in a lined tote for immediate transport to HMPA. No HAZ service code on barcode, no OP-900 or OP-950A paperwork attached, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name found on outer packaging. DescribePack: One of four 3.78 L plastic bottles lost 2oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined, and area well ventilated.

item.title: Report E-2023120060
item.description:
Report E-2023120060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, (2) 55DF's containing Sulfuric Acid 1.500 (UN1830) fell over as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation forcing the bung caps to loosen and release 20-gallons of product on the pallet, the trailer floor, and the asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and solidified the liquid with oil dry. The impacted pallet was cut-up and containerized with the rest of the spill debris into (3) 55DF's for waste disposal. No storm drains, water ways, or soil were impacted by the release.

  • Description: On November 321st, during the PM sort a package was found leaking. The package held a plastic jerrican containing UN1197, Extracts, liquid, 3, III. The lid of the plastic jerrican was loose allowing the liquid to escape. The shipper was contacted to help determine the disposition of the pacakge after it was placed into steel salvage packaging.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Admin were alerted to hazmat traveling down from overhead via discharge chute by Prime 4 / Mezzanine Collection 9 and donned PPE. Package was gathered and immediately transported to HMPA. All released material remained contained within torn outer packaging. DescribePack: 1 tspn of solid material was lost due to mishandling; hazmat package was sent up on overhead. Overhead scan captured on Ftrack at 12:10 11/29. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, and ventilation utilized.

  • Description: 11/4/2023, 0115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 281407 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a hydrochloroc acid spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box with a glass bottle inside. The inner glass bottle broke due to misandling, resulting in spillage and total loss. The shipment is set for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the discovery of the package, it was promptly placed into a hazardous bag and then subsequently transferred into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage. The surrounding surfaces were also whipped down. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat QA station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the 1-gallon bottles had a loose cap which resulted in a leakage when mishandled. Nearly half of the bottle had spilled and the box was nearly soaked in the liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was brought to our attention; it was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then subsequently transferred into a red hazardous tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023120014
item.description:
Report E-2023120014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a customer location release of UN1203 Husqvarna 4-Stroke Fuel from 18 boxes each containing (4) 110-ounce metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3 x 3 area of the pallet full of boxes of product. A total of 72 damaged cans and all impacted cardboard boxes were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Nashville, TN for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023111237
item.description:
Report X-2023111237

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found mishandled on non-compatible belt rollers. No overhead scans on ftrack. Package removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Package was not oriented upward despite vented cap warnings on outer packaging. Two of four 5L plastic jerricans lost 0.3 gal of fluid due to lying on their side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. The tote used for transporting damaged package and spillage was lined with a hazbag.

item.title: Report X-2023111231
item.description:
Report X-2023111231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023111231 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used. 2. X-2023111232 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. Please note that hazmat 786532313790 was impacted but experienced no internal spillage. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used.
